meanings.definition: Rid (someone or something) of an unwanted quality, condition, or feeling.
meanings.sent1: She decided to purge her closet of old clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company needed to purge toxic chemicals from their production process.
meanings.sent3: After the purge of expired items, the fridge looked much cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His morning run helped him purge the stress from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped to purge the city of dust and pollution.

meanings.definition: Remove (a group of people considered undesirable) from an organization or place.
meanings.sent1: The school had to purge the troublemakers from the class.
meanings.sent2: The dictator decided to purge all dissenters from the government.
meanings.sent3: The purge of noisy neighbors made the apartment building much quieter.
meanings.sent4: The new manager wanted to purge the team of negative attitudes.
meanings.sent5: The forest ranger had to purge the invasive species to protect the ecosystem.

meanings.definition: An act of removing or getting rid of something unwanted or undesirable.
meanings.sent1: The purge of expired products was necessary to maintain quality.
meanings.sent2: The annual purge of old files helped organize the office.
meanings.sent3: The community organized a purge of litter in the park.
meanings.sent4: The purge of negative energy brought a sense of peace to the room.
meanings.sent5: The purge of old habits led to a healthier lifestyle.
